website_summaries.verdict: Fitbit’s fitness smartwatch has gotten better with an infusion of watch faces and apps, but some of its extra-smart features still aren't as polished as the competition.
pros: Fitbit Ionic has a better-than-most-smartwatches four-day battery life, while still having always-on heart rate and a comfy fit
It has features galore: waterproofing, GPS and on-wrist mobile payments, plus new watch faces and a growing app store
It works with iOS and Android, and has an excellent phone app and social community
cons: Wrist payments don't work with as many banks as Apple Pay and Android Pay
On-wrist music is hard to set up and use
Software and apps sometimes feel buggy

customer_reviews.title: Endless problems
customer_reviews.text: This watch has a lot of bugs and Fitbit is not dealing with them. Watch has Bluetooth connection problems (connected, not connected, connected, not connected). Syncing issues (says its syncing but no information is transferred). I bought three watches and I'm having the same problem with two of them. Very frustrating when support cant seem to resolve and there is no information online to help troubleshoot. They had me delete and reconnect twice to no avail. Looking at blogs a lot of people are having the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Runny Babbit

customer_reviews.title: Annoyed.
customer_reviews.text: I originally left a 5-star review. After the recent software update I can no longer give it such a positive review. At the moment I wanna chuck it in the garbage. Really, I'd like my money back tho.. Ever since the 2.0 update this thing vibrates and alerts me EVERY SINGLE DAY (usually right when I'm sitting down for dinner) to calibrate the device. Calibration fails every time. Tech support has no solution. Literally was told to just ignore it. Umm... it's tied to my wrist and it's vibrating!!! Ignore it? I wish I never bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year warranty expires it will break and they only offer you a paltry 25% discount to buy the same product. I used to be a loyal Fitbit customer from back when the flex was first released. I then purchased a Charge and then this product. I will never again spend money or invest within as it is shoddy and shady that products die as soon as warranty has expired. I will make sure everyone I know is aware of this.
customer_reviews.author: Nichola H.

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT WILL NOT LAST
customer_reviews.text: I have tried FitBit for the past four years. I kept telling myself it would get better, they would figure it out. Unfortunately no luck. In 4 years, I have gone through 4 devices. While they replaced one under warranty, the other 3 I had to pay for. Each one failed between 13-15 months after purchase, and they only cover replacements under one year. My last Ionic died after 15 months, and no more, I am walking away from FitBit. I just cannot justify paying $250 every year to replace the hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed if you have a newer phone stay away.
customer_reviews.text: After having this for 4 months it now does not sync with my phone. (Note 8) There have also been many Android users who have had the same issue with this as well. I loved my Surge But I'm done with fitbit now. I can't even get it to connect to my computer. I have a $300 watch I can't use. I am so disappointed and I can't believe I lost $300. Tach support was not help either. After chatting with me all day though messanger their only solution was it was not compatible that's it and that was after chatting with them all day and they knew what phone I had the whole time.....
customer_reviews.author: Steph C. Brentson

customer_reviews.title: 2 Different watches same software errors
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd would upgrade from my charge 2 to the Ionic,, the key word being thought, but I was never able to use it. After opening the box I started to add the Ionic to my Fitbit account, but instead of the 30 minutes, I ended up spending 2 hours with FitBit tech support they determined it was a defective watch. So, I setup a return/replacement and sure enough the second one had the same exact software errors. Clearly they have huge software problems with the Ionic and I would not recommend this watch to anyone. If, I could give it zero stars I would. I will go back to me charge 2.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Beats Apple Watch on Fitness
customer_reviews.text: I labored over the decision to get a Fitbit Ionic or an Apple Watch. I even borrowed borrowed my wife’s Apple Watch for 2 weeks. Ultimately I realized that the software experience around fitness for the Apple Watch is severely lacking. You’ll love the Ionic if you’re a runner, swimmer or generally enjoy tracking your fitness closely. This includes activity, GPS, heart rate and sleep. Also, the sleep tracking is something the Apple Watch will never be able to offer because of battery considerations. So far I love my Ionic. I’m really hoping Fitbit can successfully replicate the awesome app ecosystem that Pebble created prior to being acquired by Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: MCano

customer_reviews.title: Dies after 17 months
customer_reviews.text: I can not recommend a Fitbit Ionic to anyone. After almost a year and a half it completely died. Worked fine one day, went to bed and next day it was dead. No way to reset it and Fitbit help said all they could do is offer a discount on a new one. So $200 for a year and a half of use doesn't seem like much of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: G. Habbart

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold charge
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this watch. Worked great for 2 months and now it will not hold a charge for more than 24 hours. For the price point on this product I would expect better. ***Aug 2018 update*** Changed from 2 stars to 1. I just replaced the Ionic for the 2nd time in less than a year. I will probably continue to replace the watch until Fitbit stops sending me free replacements and then go with a different brand. For the price point of this watch I expect a lot more. I will say that customer service with Fitbit has been good, very easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Allen

customer_reviews.title: Things you should know about Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: There are hundreds of posts on the Fitbit Ionic support forum from people, like me, whose Ionic was bricked by a recent firmware update. Fitbit is not inclined to replace the units they bricked, instead hiding behind "we can't change our warranties" and other corporate speak. It demonstrates they are totally irresponsible when the company is now fully aware of their negligence. At least 6 months have now past since they became aware of the problem and a lame discount off a new Ionic isn't going to cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Bushido

customer_reviews.title: only lasted one year and buggy the entire time
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother wasting your money. I had constant syncing problems with my phone and the watch has died a painful death. For the money, I was expecting something better. Very dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Burr

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Ordered twice. First one I received didnt power up...just had a series of lines on screen. The replacement powered up....and several hours later after working to set it up and troubleshooting why i couldnt get features to work, syncing issues, etc i had enough. Ive had multiple Fitbit devices in the past and this was by far the most troublesome and least successful device they have made. Upon further investigation i found the Fitbit Support to be lackluster and deceptive. Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: D.Johnson

customer_reviews.title: New Fitbit Ionic Smartwatch is Amazing
customer_reviews.text: The setup was super easy and the watch is very comfortable. It's great to be able to go running without my phone and still listen to music as well as shower with it on. The sleep stuff is way cooler than I thought it would be - it's great to see how much light, deep, and REM sleep I get, especially compared to people my age and gender. Very happy overall. The battery lasts 100+ hours too which is way better than the Apple watch which only lasts 18 hours. Works great on my Android phone and my daughter's iPhone too. I'm definitely getting one for my parents on both sides and my siblings for Christmas. Nice job Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bakken

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and mind. Don’t buy this trash.
customer_reviews.text: Buy ANYTHING but Fitbit. My watch was FORCED to update then bricked. I went to war with Fitbit and was able to get a “complimentary replacement”. If you see this message you’ve been full on warned. Do not purchase any Fitbit products!!!
customer_reviews.author: Seetharaman Family

customer_reviews.title: Maaive issues with syncing
customer_reviews.text: Got this yesterday and have been trying to sync it ever since -- absolutely will not work. I've been to the forums (fora) and done everything suggested -- It will not work. I had a Versa lite and it synced fine, so I don't understand what the issue is. ONe thing I've seen on the hundreds and hundreds of complaints on the fora is that it won't sync with many kinds of very popular phones, including Huawei, which is certainly one of the best selling phone brands on the planet earth. And, as I said, my Versa lite worked with it fine. Don't waste your money on this horrible watch.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Henry

customer_reviews.title: Won't sync with phone - common, documented problem in forums.  Fitbit support no help.  Rushed product!!
customer_reviews.text: Won't pair with smartphone. It worked initially but then it unpaired itself and wouldn't pair again. Worked through the problem with Fitbit support for an hour and the best they could do was wipe it clean. Clearly they rushed this product to get it out prior to the holidays. It is not ready for prime time hence the acute price drop and the bad reviews. Better luck next time Fitbit.....
customer_reviews.author: Nerd_Baller

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a lemon.
customer_reviews.text: I love the tracker, but in the past 3 months (or 9 months after purchase) i begin experiencing quite a bit of problem in Bluetooth connectivity with the Iphone...on and off connecting until yesterday, 8/29, when it finally decided not to connect, ever again....Tried all resetting procedures, including factory reset (which cancels all of your data). Very disappointing. At this price, you would aspect this watch to last at least few years and not 11 months.
customer_reviews.author: Sabino D.

customer_reviews.title: Fit Bit makes a very poor quality product and their customer service is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch for my Husband in June of 2018. It lasted 9 months. Fit Bit sent another one to replace it in March and it "died" this week. They were rude on the phone and not willing to take any responsibility for the poor quality of this product. We bought the 3 year extended warranty from Assyrian and I hope they will replace the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Dozier

customer_reviews.title: Great Features if it works!
customer_reviews.text: My Ionic just died- totally dead. it is only 15 months old and I took very good care of it. Some of the functions never worked all that great. Loading music was difficult. The sleep tracking worked okay and I liked the displays. But when you pay nearly $300 and it only lasts 15 months, that is just poor quality. From reading the Fitbit forums, I would say there are a lot of unhappy Ionic users.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE/BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit is the worst product with the worst customer service I have ever encountered. My first Fitbit broke right after the 1 year mark. It was the Alta and the band peeled from the unit. I was stupid enough to purchase an Ionic next. I’ve had it for only 3 months and my account was hacked. It’s been over a week and multiple phone calls with zero resolution. The watch is basically useless. And I have received no support. If you look at the Better Business Bureau website there is an exact same complaint. Go to Apple and buy their watch. I’m so sorry I didn’t. I know have a $250 paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Geanine Hunt

customer_reviews.title: I love the Ionic
customer_reviews.text: I have to give it five stars. I have been running with a Garmin 110 for about 4 years. I love the Ionic. I was super nervous about buying it because runners typically use Garmin. The Ionic lets you customize the stats and the watch is super easy to read while running. One of the reasons I chose this watch was so I could listen to music without my phone. I’m using Bluetooth Bose headphones. It’s awesome! Bottom line...do your research and choose the watch that’s right for you. My husband got theGarmin Vivoactive HR because it has golf. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Longenecker

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE ON AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: If you have any issue with your Ionic watch and need a replacement, you'll need to give Ionic the order number for your purchase. If you buy an Ionic outside of Ionic's own website, you will not receive an order number. Meaning you're just throwing money away. Wish I knew this before buying, I'd purchase an Apple Watch instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit never holds out for more than a year
customer_reviews.text: Exactly like my previous FitBit products, this has disappointed me. I gave it another chance, against my better judgment. Should have gone with Apple. I’ve had this product maybe 3 months. During workout last week (of all times), it decided it needed to reboot. Sometimes it will even shut off completely. It’s fully charged. I’ve reset it to factory. I’ve rebooted it MANY times. I even restored it to factory settings. No help from Fitbit due to purchasing from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Heather S

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy is non existent.....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Iconic to upgrade my Charge 2, Unfortunately for a person needing to accurately track pulse rate, like recovering from heart attack, or working through Afib this will kill you, the Charge 2 I originally bought in Nov is spot on, verified by my Cardiologist and my chest monitor, I have tried 2 of the Iconics, and unfortunatly working through the forums and customer service the pulse rate is off by at least 35 beats per minute, totaly unacceptable to anyone needing that accuracy in their workout, I really wanted to love this fitbit product, but I'm going to have to rely on my charge 2.......
customer_reviews.author: R. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Ionic Watch Died just outside their 12 month warranty
customer_reviews.text: I paid $285 to purchase the Fitbit Ionic in January 2018 and it completely died and stopped working this summer. I called Fitbit to see if they could help me. They said my device was outside of their 12 month warranty and told me there was nothing they could do about it. I was shocked that Fitbit didn't offer to try to repair or replace my Fitbit Ionic device. A watch that cost this much money should not fail just outside of 12 months. I did like the watch when it was working but it appears that several other people have had the same thing happen with their Fitbit Ionic watch being defective just outside the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Fitness Goals Inspired And Always Fresh!
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing a lot of research on fitness tracking watches and comparing the differences between FitBit, Garmin, and Apple. FitBit did win for me because of obviously how the stats are shown and spread out on the watch. It is very simple to use and exciting every time you glance down to see the time. The Ionic just feels smooth on the wrist and fits perfectly without any bulky ness or pain from metal or design flaws. All fitness trackers have the same purpose in tracking all the stats and relating to your phone, I just like how this one shows on its’ specific app. Keeps my fitness goals inspired and alway fresh!
customer_reviews.author: Lavezzo

customer_reviews.title: Poor Performance
customer_reviews.text: The watch is good but very expensive. I bought this in January 2018, and by June 2018. The watch died on me. i contacted Fitbit for support and was informed that I send in the defective watch before I can get a replacement. Now, mid July 2018, I have not received a replaced yet. I am disappoint about the watch's reliability. After spending $250 for a watch that last 4 months. To make a worst, I have bought extra bands and charger that has become useless. After this watch, I will not be purchasing another Fitbit product. Word to the wise, get something else. Not a good product. Previous owner of Fitbit Surge. Same crappy product
customer_reviews.author: glenties

customer_reviews.title: Poor reliability: failed in less than 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this Fitbit Ionic for 8-1/2 months and last week it started failing (false recording of steps and distance, time off by 3 hours, loss of charge in less than a day). Yesterday it stopped charging and working completely. It is totally unacceptable that a sports smart watch of that price (or anyplace) should fail this quickly. Fitbit should exchange this effective unit immediately.
customer_reviews.author: olivier Garret

customer_reviews.title: 2 of my 3 fitbits died just a little past 365 days...no warranty after that.
customer_reviews.text: I have to tell you I have had 2 fitbits. The most recent is the ionic. I bought it a little over a year ago. 14 days ago it just stopped working.🥺 I've done all the "hold this button and clean the sensors". Nothing. I called and there is nothing I can do to get it repaired or replaced as a year has gone by. They did offer a 25% discount on my next purchase of a New fitbit. These aren't cheap watches. It seems it is set up for a little over a year to work and then Die.🤔 I will be looking to a new smartwatch company.
customer_reviews.author: trisha

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit does not stand behind their products
customer_reviews.text: Before you buy a fitbit, you might want to reconsider. I had a $300 Ionic that worked fine until FITBIT sent an update last night that turned it into a brick. FITBIT support said there is nothing they can do, since it is out of warranty. It's approximately 90 days past it's one year warranty and FITBIT caused the problem. That is a great business plan. I have had 4 other Fitbit products and liked the features of the Ionic, but FITBIT's product support has always been less than admirable. I believe it's time for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: rlnewb84

customer_reviews.title: Battery won't hold a charge after 14 months
customer_reviews.text: From my wife: I LOVED this watch for 14 months. Wore it 24/7. Used it regularly for GPS tracking on runs, treadmill runs, interval training, swimming, heart-rate, sleep tracking etc. But after 14 months, it won't hold a charge. The battery completely dies after 3.5 hrs. Since Fitbit only warranties their products for 12 months or less... I'm basically SOL. $300 product that won't even last 2 years? My Fitbit Surge lasted 3 years... and I "upgraded" to this; definitely not worth it. I guess I'll have to try the Samsung watch or the Applewatch...
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: don’t buy this item
customer_reviews.text: It was great for a week then it would not take a charge so they sent the centerpiece again then the bands won’t lock in so the thing fell off my wrist about 1 million times I’m talking with a foreigner who I cannot understand and now they’re going to send me one piece of the band when I send them a picture of the band not locking in ... this has been the biggest waste of time this is their last shot and then this item is going back I And I will buy an iwatch which is what I should’ve done in the first place
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Design of music download is awful
customer_reviews.text: This is my last Fitbit. Cannot download music because the app has to do it on wifi and cannot find my (or any) network. Cannot just plug into pc and download? NO! I have done everything but switch out my router. I do not want a Pandora subscriptiin. I have gone from Flex to Charger to Blaze to Ionic. Next smartwatch will be Apple. Disappointed in this version. It does good job tracking workouts.
customer_reviews.author: F Clark

customer_reviews.title: Crashing, yet again
customer_reviews.text: I LOATHE this watch. It was the biggest waste of money. It doesn't do jack. It crashes. It fails to connect. It sometimes tells me the time, sometimes tracks my steps, and sometimes connects to phones and apps. $5 pedometers work better than this. Right now I'm dealing with yet another crash and I am so frustrated. I hate this thing, and the only reason I refuse to replace it is that it hasn't completely shut down yet nor has it broken. Pro: battery life and emails about battery life Cons: Every-flipping-thing else!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: 13 Months & 1 day- life expectancy
customer_reviews.text: 13 months 1 day. Yes that’s how long mine lasted before the screen went completely black. The hard reset didn’t work. I called Fitbit & it’s out of warranty at 12 months. It seems like this is a very common problem. I previously owned a charge hr and this didn’t happen. Last Fitbit I’ll own. Now I’m waiting for the same thing to happen to my sons’ fitbits.
customer_reviews.author: Leena

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 1 year and 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I had this watch for 1 year and 6 months and then all of a sudden the battery started to die within one day. Do a Google search on this and you will see it is a common problem. If you are within your 1 year warranty and this happens they will send you another watch, but if you are outside of that warranty, too bad they send you a 25% coupon to buy another one their disposable items. I don't expect an item that cost over $250 to be disposable, but that is exactly what this watch is. Fitbit has lost me as a customer.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: A great upgrade from charge2
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to ionic from the charge 2 and I love it. The best parts, in my opinion, are the larger screen, it can get wet, and that it tracks treadmill use better. After four months of use I bought a different clock face change that is on the fit bit app. This new clock face, Big Weather by OziByte, didn't last very long and I was told to use another clock face. Also during this time my watch started to act squirrelly, where I couldn't get the screen to turn on properly, I reset it per the video instructions and it works fine now. If it happens again I'll add an update.
customer_reviews.author: scott schaefers

customer_reviews.title: FITBIT DOES NOT WARRANTY CRACKED SCREENS.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I am very unsatisfied with this experience. When I purchase this watch and accessories for nearly $350, I did not know FITBIT consider it disposable. I’ve only had the watch for 6 months and the watch face cracked. FITBIT DOES NOT WARRANTY CRACKED SCREENS.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I had this device for about 1.5 years and worked fine until 2020 when there was a system upgrade. My watch would not charge or turn on, not even a manufactor reset would work. I contacted Fitbit and they refused to do anything since I was past 1 year warranty mark even though it was a malfunction from their system upgrade. They only offered to give me 40% off a new same device or newer device within 14 days. mind you I spend $250 for this device that only lasted past there warranty mark. Don't buy anything from Fitbit horrible company!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for a Christmas gift. Spent $299.00 on it and it only lasted a year and 1/2. They will only give us 25% off on another one. That is awful to spend that much money on something that lasted for such a short amount of time and was not abused.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: There are things to like about FitBit like the battery life. But alas that is what turned us to unhappy FitBit owners. My wife's Ionic started having issues after about 5 months (purchased in July and issues started in December). The battery was dying super quick and the watch wouldn't stay connected to her phone. They were quick to identify the battery issue, but a replacement took 13 days to arrive and they sent a used or refurbished device. That is no way to support a product like the Ionic. So we now have something for the junk drawer. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: EcoJon

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness/smart watch when it worked
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This fitbit was an awesome fitness tracker and smart watch while it worked. It has some great apps, watch faces, and even keeps track of the weather. Cons: It only worked for 13 months & from what I'm reading elsewhere is about all you can expect from this watch. It just quit working one night while it was sitting on my dresser while I was sleeping. I reached out to Fitbit to find out where I could send it to get repaired and they said there isn't any place to get it repaired. The warranty was 12 months so all they would offer was 40% off another watch! Why would I want another defective watch!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Great until there is a problem
customer_reviews.text: I preordered the ionic in September and it arrived in October. Loved the upgrade and added features from my charge2. After three and a half months it suddenly drained the battery in a day and stopped charging. After several chats with fitbit support and attempted fixes I was told the warranty would cover a replacement, which is great except for they refuse to ship the replacement until the broken item is received. A little frustrating since the prepaid label provided is ground shipping and means you are without your $300 tracker for two weeks. Fitbit customer service has declined with this product, too bad considering previous warranty issues were resolved within a few days
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not a durable product- look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Good thing there is a 1-year warranty because I am on my 4th Ionic. Same problem over and over - the screen comes detached and it quits working. So disappointed. Fitbit will replace it until the warranty is up, but then it’s a loss. Also, they won’t replace it with a different device - I have to pay 50% of the cost, even though I’d be downgrading.
customer_reviews.author: Mauka

customer_reviews.title: Consider yourself lucky if it last one & half years
customer_reviews.text: I do like the look and feel of the watch. It also have great capabilities except for pandora exclusively. I don't have the pandora subscription so that is absolutely useless to me. BUT! The number one issue with this watch is the life span...not the battery, the whole watch. My first one lasted 3 months, which was replaced by Fitbit which was great. But the replacement lasted just over a year; which ofcourse the warranty would have ended by then. In all honesty, the only way I would buy another one...is if it goes on sale for 30 bucks. Not even for $31.00. $30.00
customer_reviews.author: Sheril Smith

customer_reviews.title: Look for another option
customer_reviews.text: I do NOT recommend the Ionic. I have had two previous Fitbit watched and loved them, but have had multiple issues with my Ionic, as has everyone else I know. I'm on my 3rd watch (warranty) for various reasons. It rarely syncs my notifications, even when I restart my phone, the watch, unpaid and repair. I love the tracking, but the battery drains quickly when using it for several hours of continuous exercise. I will be looking at other options in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery not charging to 100%. Zero support.
customer_reviews.text: For the past two weeks or so the battery will not charge up to 100%. I was told that other users have experienced similar issue. In my case, it recently started to randomly reboot. I have had several back and forths with fitbit but they are not supportive at all. In order to move forward with any warranty claim, they want you to make sure that you manually sync the device 5-6 times a day until the battery fully depletes. I guess I have to put on my calendar reminders for something that is supposed to be their job! I wouldn't recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: YB

customer_reviews.title: Offers great features at great price.
customer_reviews.text: I started with a Fit Bit charge 2 - had for many years. Upgraded end of this year and chose between an Apple watch and the Fitbit Ionic. I have an iPhone but chose the Fitbit Ionic. Reasons Ionic over Apple Watch: Cost, I didn't need a whole computer on my wrist; I use a laptop at work, I have a laptop and desk computer at home, I have an iPhone. Features Ionic offered that appealed to me: Larger readable screen, apps not available on charge 2, can read the whole text message-even though I can't respond with iPhone (Android only at this time-updates will be coming), GPS encrypted, more choices of colors.
customer_reviews.author: Jacke

customer_reviews.title: Good but does not live up to water proof standards!
customer_reviews.text: It is OK meanwhile you don't get it wet, even when the specs states that it is water proof the problem I had it was that it got wet, battery then went dead and the watch was useless after that. Looking at issues on fitbit page I see there are a lot of problems realted to the quality of this product. And on top of all mine failed just past the date of the warrantee expiration. It was good until I proved that it was not water proof. I would recomend that if you buy it try it out with water as much as possible before you warantee expires.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Barahona

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give this a great review. I saved a while to purchase one at $249. And today less than 9 months after purchasing, it just died. It will not charge. I have done all the troubleshoots and am waiting to see if FitBit will even replace it. Something I spend a good bit of money on should NOT die so soon. Also the battery life stinks. You’re lucky to get 3 full days before it’s telling you to charge. I could go a full week with charging my HR Charge!
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive to be a disposable watch!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved everything about my Fitbit ionic!! I purchased it in March 2018..had issues after an update where the screen was unreadable in July 2018.. I want sent a replacement in July 2018.. on November 25th of 2019 it just turned off and died!! Like everyone else is saying in their reviews, it mysteriously died just passed the one-year warranty.. and upon contacting Fitbit, was told that essentially they could not help me out but they could offer me a cheezy 25% discount on a new one, which incidentally is no special offer, as my email inbox is loaded with emails from Fitbit offering me the same discount !!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura D

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Ionic Support Less Than
customer_reviews.text: Everything having to do with the Fitbit Ionic is excellent... except for the product itself. I am on my third Ionic (all failed within the 1 year warranty) and Fitbit knows this is a problem. When you call Fitbit about the failures, they are good as long as the watch is within the warranty, otherwise, they offer reduced refund. I would be ok with the reduced if it wasn't a known problem. I love my Ionic, all the features it has is perfect for what I use it for. The Fitbit website is awesome and tracks everything an athlete would want to track... but the Ionic Fitness Tracker has issues that Fitbit is not addressing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Schratz

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I bought this in April of 2018 (15 months) and it already can barely hold a battery for 12 hours. From what I’ve been hearing, Fitbit watches last about 1 year. Time to go with an Apple Watch. They do cost more but they last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quit working less than 1YEAR
customer_reviews.text: I loved my ionic got it September 28, 2018!! I have loved it every since! I was grocery shopping yesterday 9/5/2019 and it went black!!! I thought the battery was dead. But I thought I JUST got it off the charger earlier it shouldn’t be dead. I didn’t think too much of it. I got home and put it on the charger thinking it will come on and NOTHING!!!!!! I tried getting on the app it kept saying no device found. I’m like WTF!!!!!!! Less than a year $300 down the drain!!!!! I kept debating if I should go between Apple Watch and Fitbit and now I wish I would have went with Apple Watch!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lasted two months past the 1 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Daughter who loved it. It started having problems just after a year. She called for support and basically was told to reboot it which she tried 5 times and it still did not work. She has tried researching and found others that have had the same problem. FitBit offered a small percentage toward a purchase of a new one. With this one costing $300.00 it was still to much. She is very upset at FitBit and feels they have not owned up to a problem many are having.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: Ionic bricks out of nowhere.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these even after reading a few reviews that other people's had bricked. Then, 3 months in, mine suddenly did. After googling the problem I saw a lot of people had this issue and fitbit has been entirely ignoring it. Who cares what the watch can do if it bricks after a couple months? This is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Layne Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Watch stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: The watch fails to charge. Ironically it failed a few days after the return policy date expired. I have had the blaze for years without issues that weren’t the watches fault and still like it, but I wanted the GPS feature on the Ionic. Even bought a charging stand in addition to the one supplied by manufacturer. I had seen others with same failure issue. Will be calling product support today hoping to get it rectified. Will update as I progress.
customer_reviews.author: GLABSr

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I would give it a 0 if I could. Purchased this watch 14 months ago and it no longer works because of an update FITBIT CREATED AND RELEASED! After contacting tech support, it was deemed unrepairable due to a firmware issue (updating to OS 3). Because it is out of the 1 year warranty, Fitbit will not replace it. They were kind enough to offer 25% off on a new watch **eyeroll** Fitbit has lost a loyal customer because of this.
customer_reviews.author: shanvan21

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do what it claims!
customer_reviews.text: I spent the morning trying to download music to my ionic with no luck. I followed every set of online instructions that I could find. I then called Fitbit and was on the phone for just over two hours. They couldn't fix it and said that they would contact me in a couple of days via email. Just to get some more info from me. The guy on the phone said that the ionic is having compatibility issues with windows. My question is why are they selling an item that is have compatibility issues then? I'm far from the only one having this from all the reviews that I have found else where.
customer_reviews.author: SammyB

customer_reviews.title: Stay far away!
customer_reviews.text: This worked really well for 9 months, and then the HR monitor went haywire and is very inaccurate...it reads really high at rest, and fluctuates wildly during exercise. Some margin of error is expected, but this is a clear defect. Fitbit customer service is extremely unprofessional...the rep told me “this is an accuracy issue, your warranty doesn’t cover accuracy problems”. If the product isn’t accurate, then it’s useless. They refused to cover the product while under warranty, or even look at the issue...they do not stand behind their product. Save your money!!
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Lousy Watch
customer_reviews.text: Used this watch 24/7. Only time I took it off was to shower and to charge it. Worked fine for about 18 months. I loved it but for $300 and to only last 18 months is a rip off. No tech support to replace the lousy battery is rediculous. Fitbit offered 25% off of a future purchase 😂 you won’t catch me buying anything else made by Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit does not disappoint!! The GPS is also accurate for biking
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the Blaze in order to have the GPS function for running. Fitbit does not disappoint!! The GPS is also accurate for biking. I don’t know if the new heart rate monitor is any better than the Blaze’s; it seems comparable so far. Setup was simple, but it took a while. I have not used the notifications function or tried saving music to it. Once my Bluetooth headphones arrive I will be more motivated to download music onto it.
customer_reviews.author: Maria L Banach

customer_reviews.title: Stay away.. lasts 12-16 months
customer_reviews.text: Of course 1 month after the 1 year warranty, the product just died. Always charged properly, cleaned properly, babied, never put in water and just turned off and wouldnt turn on. Will be contacting their Support, but according to others, should be expecting a 40% off offer on a new device.. 200+ bucks down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit watches are unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The heart rate tracking was inaccurate, would speed up for no reason at all and had lodged complaint with Fitbit 3 times, did factory reset several times and they told me they are aware of the issue and did not tell me when it would be fixed and would not replace it even though under warranty. My husband is dealing with similar issues with his Fitbit Blaze. Their customer service is terrible and on fitbit.com there are several pages of complaints. Don’t buy fitbit product, they don’t stand behind their products. Thank you Amazon Prime for issuing me a refund
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit Ionic is everything you want and more ...for a year only! This GPS is terrific and unfailing. For one year . I’ve had mine replaced many times and even repurchased thinking it was bad luck or the “lemon” . Nope. Literally I have had three die within 18 months. They say “sorry here is 25% off ur next one” they should say “here’s 25% off ur next POS” Don’t waste your money or your precious time dealing w outsourced tech help who don’t care at all about your issues. Live and learn. Do not buy these products!
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Didnt even last a year.
customer_reviews.text: This watch hasn't even been used for a year. Worn in the shower 1-3x (suppose to be waterproof) however take it off anyway. The heartbeat feature stopped working. Reached out to support and they said it will start again in a couple days. It came back on and would say my heartbeat was 175 resting and 40 after working . Now it's just not working at all. Picture shown. For the money it should work not go out less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: corrie

customer_reviews.title: was snug at first but has stretched out. With updates it works a lot better with my old Android
customer_reviews.text: I run a Samsung S3. This watch has been a constant hassle with Bluetooth connection trying to get the WiFi on the phone to work. I can't say the Bluetooth to earbuds that comes off of this watch works great for Pandora. And I have a large wrist The Surge to fit me fine this one is on the last click so as the wrist band stretches it gets a little easier but if you have a big wrist be careful with this one. Fortunately you can change the wristbands when they break
customer_reviews.author: electric mower guy

customer_reviews.title: Watch failed 2 months after warranty ended.
customer_reviews.text: Quit working less than 2 months after the 1 year warranty expired while I was just sitting at a desk. I babied this watch, never got it wet, was always gentle with it. Of course, I am out of luck for support from Firbit, except for money off buying a new one. I feel this was a faulty watch and caution anyone on buying one without some sort of extended warranty. I have read others have problems without them honoring it, so do so at your own risk. I had multiple connection issues when there was a software update and the programs for it are limited and fairly useless. I don't plan on getting another fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: jeff forsha

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for about a year
customer_reviews.text: Of course just out of the warranty window my fitbit ionic's screen is black. It is still vibrating for notifications, syncing, and heart rate monitor is working. But I cannot see anything but a black screen on the device. I've always had good luck with customer support so I contacted them and they were no help but to offer me a discount on a new product. Yay... just what I want after spending $300 on the watch to begin with is to drop another couple hundred bucks on a watch that may or may not work for another year.
customer_reviews.author: MaeBerry

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy is dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade for my FitBit Charge2, hoping it would be better. It actually got worse. The biggest problem is with the altimeter. Everyday, it accounts random altitude climbed. It showed over 117 floors one day. Also, sometimes when I wake up it shows I've walked 17000 steps, even before I got out of bed. I called customer service and they tried to explain that some daily activities can be accounted as steps climbed (like opening doors or driving). I've had previous versions (FitBit Charge and Charge2) and they never had that problem. It's clear to me that the technology used on Ionic does not work well.
customer_reviews.author: HENRIQUE C FAGUNDES

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for my Gear S2...lousy battery life
customer_reviews.text: Like this fitbit ionic. Charged up really quick. This replaced my samsung gear 2. This watch does everything I needed that my gear could do. But better battery life and it IS water proof. My gear wouldn't work for days until it dried out before I would be able to wear it 4/24/20 Battery has died and the watch is not a year old. I have tried every publish work around.fix I could find. I did not purchase a protection plan so I am.pretty sure I am SOL :( I have read many reviews that this happens. Ut I thought perhaps with first iconic off the line. Seems to be a pervasive problem in the software.
customer_reviews.author: Dionne Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit bricked after update, just outside warranty.  Fitbit support.....Buy a NEW ONE LOL!!
customer_reviews.text: Liked the features and battery life. After one year of moderate use, the battery will not hold a charge for more then 8 hours and it DIES!! Other reviews talk about features missing compared to Apple Watch, it is NOT an apple watch but the quality if POOR if you are looking to keep for any period of time. Update: Recovered from battery issue but now I have the blue logo of death. Updated fitbit software and it bricked my Ionic. Support states nothing they can do because they already replaced one for the same issue. WHAT?! Stay far away from FITIBT junk as you can!!
customer_reviews.author: Long time buyer

customer_reviews.title: Broken!!
customer_reviews.text: Screen stops working after 14 months. Not worth $250. No drops, has a screen protector and silicone cover all it's life. Read about similar lifespans. Shame.
customer_reviews.author: Imagine

customer_reviews.title: Totally Inoperable After Limited Use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased om Oct 2017. Encountered major battery failure and total operational failure in April 2019. Watch totally dead. Expect better quality and performance from Fitbit and watch at this price point (cost $300+ at time of purchase). When I first contacted Fitbit Support to report problems, first told to perform Factory Reset, which was unsuccessful, then informed watch was beyond warranty period, when I responded with recourse request, was offered discount to purchase new Fitbit product!!! What?? For an obvious major mechanical/technical malfunction? Assumed Fitbit had a higher standard. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Manhattan Beach

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Feb. 2019. Worked great until update was installed then everything went down hill, kept losing my watch face, just the fitbit logo shows on the face half the time, battery needs to be charged everyday, and fitbit will not honor the warranty!!! POS Company, sorry for the language but I paid good money for their product. And it is total crap, just look at the other reviews, same problems, and if you don't have this problem, don't worry after you hit the 1 year mark you definitely will. I'm going to switch to a Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: rob wehrle

customer_reviews.title: Too many problems
customer_reviews.text: This Fitbit has been nothing but a headache. Unfortunately I upgraded from the blaze to the ionic and I regret it. The first ionic I bought did not work at all so I exchanged it. I’ve had the second one for about six months and now it has completely died. The time that it did work it malfunctioned continuously. I could never get the music to sync despite hours of trying. I really wanted to love this Fitbit but I absolutely do not recommend it. It was very frustrating and not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie B.

customer_reviews.title: Beware World wide Distributors!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a World Wide Distributor review more than Ionic Fitbit! Product is definitely USED and defective!! Cable cord wrapper was already ripped in half , other protective labels had been reapplied! Fitbit would NOT charge with supplied cord or charger base bought for watch. Numerous usb plugs were tried and they all work with other products. After 2 hours of trying to get it to just turn on, I decided I was sold a lemon. VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH THIS SELLER! Returning for refund and buying watch elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Grey

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in just over a year
customer_reviews.text: This watch worked okay at first, but after about 6 months of regular use, the battery life significantly decreased. The fully-charged watch couldn't last for a run of more than 7 miles with GPS enabled and music playing. The watch would shut down mid-run once the charge reached around 20%. Now, after 16 months of use, it will no longer even charge. We have contacted Fitbit support, but the only suggestion that they had was to have us reset the watch. This has allowed it to turn on, but none of the issues with battery life have been fixed. For this price, I'm disappointed in the quality and will not be buying another Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: S B

customer_reviews.title: Junk after 16 months
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd Fitbit after 16 months they go to crap! I wear it as designed. Thought it was me the first 2 but now I'm convinced they are junk!!
customer_reviews.author: Malinda peschong

customer_reviews.title: Died 2 months after warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: I would give this product zero stars if I could. I've owned this product for 14 months. The warranty in the US is 12 months. Without warning, the Fitbit completely died. It was showing a red exclamation point in a triangle error message but now it's completely unresponsive. Factory reset instructions the community moderators instruct you to do just don't work because the Fitbit is completely unresponsive. I used to love this smart watch. I loved it so much that I bought my husband one. That's $500 down the drain. Hopefully his breaks during the warranty period. Don't waste your money on this version of the Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer G.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice watch.  I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.text: So far, everything I hoped it would be. I have previously used the Samsung Gear S2, the Fitbit Alta HR and my wife has the Fitbit Blaze. This is the best of them all. Easy to set up. The HRM is very accurate. Was at the doctor's office, this week, and the watch had my HR at exactly what the nurse measured it at. Visually, it is bright and easy to read--even in direct sunlight. Battery lasts 3-4 days for me...and I have both personal and work email joining my text and Fitbit alerts buzzing me frequently. PS: Having the Starbucks app on it is a plus for my coffee habit! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ric Sarro

customer_reviews.title: I have owned it for 5 months and it stopped working? For $230.00 are you kidding me. What can I do?
customer_reviews.text: This is my second fitibt. My first one was a champion, I saw this new addition and liked it. All of a sudden in the last week it stopped working. It was only 5 months old. I thought it was the chargign device, so I purchased another one. The chargign unit an watch have been plugged in for 4 hours, the watch is dead?? If you read other reviews apparently this is a trait of this model. Amazon how can you standard behind such a product!! A loyal user of Amazon, and will never buy Fitbit again. Google you got fooled....
customer_reviews.author: APV

customer_reviews.title: Do noy buy.  Will not last
customer_reviews.text: This unit "died" within a year. Had it replaced and the new one also "died". Replacement also died within a year and was replaced. Sadly the replacement for the replacement lasted 14 months and also died. Was offered a 25% discount to purchase a new fitbit. Still $200 for a unit that has consistently died within 8-14 months. Don't waste your $.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Truly terrible experience. I was excited to try something new after having an Apple watch 3 and switching to Android it's been impossible to find a good fitness tracker or smart watch. Their OS is in need of serious work not to mention the bugs that make it impossible to use. It's like going back in time 10 years when trying to set this thing up. Not intuitive at all. It doesn't even come with a half charge when unboxing. I can't remember the last time I had a new piece of electronics that didn't do this. On top of it all the"back" button was defective and didn't work. Returning to Amazon today
customer_reviews.author: Mightyjoe

customer_reviews.title: 3rd watch in 10.5 months
customer_reviews.text: The Ionic is a great fitness watch/tracker, when it's actually functional. I ordered my first Ionic June of 2018 and about 10.5 months later, I have a second replacement on its way because for some reason the watch just randomly dies and never turns back on. The customer service representatives who have helped me both times were extremely apologetic and helpful, but that doesn't erase the fact that a $300 watch cannot keep itself alive for more than one year. My initial watch lasted about 8 months before it decided to just shut off completely and the replacement watch Fitbit sent me only lasted 2. We'll see how long the third one lasts, but don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: JACB

customer_reviews.title: Good looking watch with nice features
customer_reviews.text: Loving the watch so far after a week use. Biggest drawback IMO is lack of Spotify app and “streaming”, but since it doesn’t have LTE I guess it’s understandable. Floor counter has been added to Fitbit stat tracking I’ve gotten accustomed to from Alta HR. Exercise tracking feature is awesome! One month later: Loving this smart watch. Built-in GPS is extremely accurate and built-in exercise tracking is a great feature. IMO, I think Adidas add-in is nothing but a gimmick. I wish they would expand it in the future updates to incorporate other workout programs besides the lame “running” coach it currently has. At this point, I don’t think you would miss anything if you bought the regular Ionic.
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit is not accurate and they do not stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.text: This watch does not accurately track distance. The GPS is constantly searching and does not log miles correctly. Customer support at Fitbit was unhelpful. If you read the warranty closely on Fitbit items, it states a one year limited warranty from all defects. The warranty then states that it does not cover any software embedded in the product, any visual defects, or any wear and tear. This pretty much states that Fitbit is unwilling to warrant the product they are selling. Extremely unhappy with Fitbit and I will be switching back to Garmin as they actually stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Won't sync....
customer_reviews.text: Well...it won't connect to our wireless via a Samsung Note 4, and it won't sync via Bluetooth, so whatever activity it might be able to track we have no idea. Just got our FitBit Ionic last week, and are preparing to return it unless somehow this logjam breaks. Given what we've seen of other users not being able to sync the device either we aren't holding our breath... =-/
customer_reviews.author: KLKnAK

customer_reviews.title: and the band feels much more comfortable on your wrist
customer_reviews.text: This fit bit has dramatically improved since the surge. It is more streamlined on your rest, has the face that is much easier to read, and the band feels much more comfortable on your wrist. In addition, the fact that I can wear this fit bit while swimming, is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: kennedbw

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Ionic watch failed after 17 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked well as expected although heart rate monitor often inaccurate until it just stopped taking a charge 17 months after I bought it. This is my 3rd Fitbit watch. I have also owned 2 Fitbit charge watches. All have lasted just a little over 1 year. After reading their product reviews it seems early product failure is common. Beware purchase of a Fitbit watch unless you are prepared to replace it frequently. I paid $233 for my Ionic and won’t replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Reno shopper

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed CUSTOMER!
customer_reviews.text: I have returned a Fitbit several months ago because it not working...And now the second one just not charging I can't believe a watch that costs 300.00 dollars that it only lasts for less than six months....very disappointed CUSTOMER!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Software interaction is a mess
customer_reviews.text: There are so many great things about this device, but they are overshadowed by poor software design and interface. Trying to upload music is an 'exercise' in frustration. It takes multiple attempts to do it. Then when music does start to upload, it takes a long time to transfer. Connecting the device via Bluetooth for the first time often does not work. Most of the time you have to reboot the device for the device to show up on your phone Bluetooth setting. What is really frustrating is that many times when I open the Fitbit app, I am bombarded with Fitbit advertising. Please I just want to open the app and transfer my most recent workout!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it! Doesn't even deserve 1 star.
customer_reviews.text: Worst Fitbit I have ever owned. Bought it in June. It does not keep a charge really never has. I will fully charge it through the night then go for a 4 or 5 mile run and it dies in the middle of the run. Doesn't keep a charge at all. So disappointed with this product. I have been a Fitbit wearer for years and this is the worst product. Choose the Apple watch or Garmin. Unfortunately I am outside the return window with Amazon so trying to get Fitbit to do something for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: A great gadget for seven months.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying when it works, this is a great smart watch. I have had this for seven months before it stopped synching which caused it to stop keeping the right time. A watch that can track steps and sleep but doesn’t keep time isn’t very practical. Fitbit is replacing it under their warranty but the replacement only has a warranty for the remaining months from original purchase. I have little hope that the replacement will last much longer because if it was expected to, then they would have no problem in giving me a full warranty for a year from replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Westfield

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Decided to buy for a coast to coast bicycle trip. Worked well the first 3 weeks but then started to malfunction. Would become sluggish when trying to record bike riding from exercise app. App would also shut off mid ride. Currently I can not get it to sync and the time is off by 6 hours. Last sync date was July 17th and currently September. I've reset the watch as well as deleted and reinstalled the app several times. When I get home, I'll probably try to return or use manufacturing warranty to replace. My girlfriends vera works great however.
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: Broke after THREE months
customer_reviews.text: Ufortunately my FitBit Iconic smart watch purchased on 7/22/18 stopped working only 3 short months later. I'm not sure what happened but weird blue lines show up on the screen when I am able to turn the watch on, most times, it won't even turn on... It looks as though it could be water damage although I never swam with it on, I did routinely do household dishes and take showers while wearing it. As I said, I'm unsure why the watch stopped working after only 3 months of use especially with claims of it being waterproof... I honestly don't know why else it could have stopped working... Completely disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Died
customer_reviews.text: Theres an issue with these watches- mine just died and will not hold a charge or even come on. Do a google search of Fitbit Ionic dead and read the threads in the Fitbit community board. Fitbit must know theres an issue with all these complaints, but will do nothing about it except tell you to buy another one. I'm done with FitBit...
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a runner
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my boyfriend because he’s a runner and always has to wait for his phone to charge before so he can track his run with an app. This is compatible with the app so he doesn’t have to bring his 6+ on every run/hike. It tracks literally everything that he wanted (milage, route, heart rate, calories, steps, etc). I’m pretty sure he likes the Fitbit more than he likes me. It was a perfect gift for someone that enjoys cardio/working out in general. It works well and seems accurate. It also looks super sleek and can be dressed up or down.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Baker

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service For The Win
customer_reviews.text: First, I have always been happy with the performance of all of my Fitbit products, including my Ionic. So when my Ionic stopped charging this week after a year and almost 2 months, I obviously became concerned. I came to the Amazon reviews to see if anyone had a similar issue. I grew even more concerned after reading some of the complaints about Fitbit customer service, However, I followed through and called the customer service number. I was so delighted to find the representative both concerned and knowledgeable. After trying a couple of interventions, he offered me replacement at a discount. After some more conversation and advocacy by the CS representative, I was offered a replacement!!! Thank you Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Boss Lady

customer_reviews.title: Superior health tracking
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is exceptional. I charge it while showering, and wear it pretty much every other moment of the day. The fact it doesn't require excessive charging makes it straight up superior to the iWatch as a health tracker. Heart rate is recorded all the time. From monitoring food calories and weight, I can say the calorie burn estimation is pretty close to dead on. I have lost 48.7 lbs since I got this Ionic, and I'm never giving it up.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Adams
